Also, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["w(C') = w(C)"], []), '.\n\nIt remains to prove that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' is a cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nBy the definition of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(v) < C(v)"], []), ' \nif and only if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v'], []), ' is the mate of a bad node with respect to ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['C'], []), '.\nSuppose ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' is not a cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.  Then there\nexists an edge ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['vt'], []), ' such that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(v) + C'(t) ", TexCmd('le'), ' w(v,t)'], []), '\nand ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v'], []), ' is the mate of a bad node.  Recall that the latter implies\nthat ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(v) ", TexCmd('ge'), ' N-h + C_h(v)'], []), '.\nIn other words,\n', TexDisplayMathEnv('displaymath', ["\nC'(t) <w(v,t) - C'(v) ", TexCmd('le'), ' w(v,t) - (N-h) - C_h(v).\n'], []), '\nWe can derive a contradiction as follows.\n\n', BraceGroup(TexCmd('it'), ' Case 1:'), ' ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w(v,t) ', TexCmd('le'), ' N-h'], []), '. Then ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(t) < -C_h(v) ", TexCmd('le'), ' 0'], []), ',\nwhich contradicts that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(t) ", TexCmd('geq'), ' C_h(t) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' 0'], []), '.\n\n', BraceGroup(TexCmd('it'), ' Case 2:'), ' ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w(v,t) > N-h'], []), '. Then ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G_h'], []), ' contains the\nedge ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['vt'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['C_h(v) + C_h(t) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' w(v,t) - (N-h)'], []), '.\nThus, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(t) \n< w(v,t) - (N-h) - C_h(v) ", TexCmd('leq'), ' C_h(t)'], []), ', which\ncontradicts the fact that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' allows no bad node.\n\nIn conclusion, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' is a cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.  Together with\nthe fact that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["w(C) = w(C')"], []), ', we obtain the desired contradiction\nthat ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' is a minimum weight cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' with no bad node.\nLemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('BadCover')]), ' follows.\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section', [BraceGroup('Construct a maximum weight matching')]), '\n', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('section-recover-max-weighted-matching')]), '\nThe algorithm in ', TexCmd('S'), TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec_decomp_thm')]), ' only computes the value\nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G)'], []), '.  To report the edges involved, we show below how to first construct a\nminimum weight cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), 'W/k(n, W/N))'], []), ' time and then use this\ncover to construct a maximum weight matching in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), 'm/k(n,m))'], []), ' time.\nThus, the time required to construct a maximum weight matching is\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), ' W / k(n, W/N))'], []), '.\n\n', TexNamedEnv('lemma', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('lemma-cover-decompose')]), '\nAssume that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['h, G_h, ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h'], []), ' are defined\nas in ', TexCmd('S'), TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('section-mwm-algorithm')]), '.  \nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h'], []), ' be any minimum weight\ncover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h'], []), '.\nIf ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' is a function on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'], []), ' such that\nfor every ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'], []), ',  \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) = ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) + ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(u)'], []), ',\nthen\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion')], []), ' is a minimum weight cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', ['\nConsider any edge ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['uv'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.  If ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['uv'], []), ' is not\nin ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h'], []), ', then ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w(u,v) ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) + ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(v)\n', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) + ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(v)'], []), '.  Assume that \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['uv'], []), ' is in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h'], []), '.\nNote that its weight \nin ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h'], []), ' is ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w(u, v) - ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) - ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(v)'], []), '.\nSince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h'], []), ' is a  cover,\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(u) + ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(v) ', TexCmd('geq'), '\nw(u, v) - ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) - ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(v)'], []), '.\nThus, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) + ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(v) = \n', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) + ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(u) +\n', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(v) + ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(v)\n', TexCmd('geq'), ' w(u, v)'], []), '. It follows that\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion')], []), ' is a  cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nTo show that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion')], []), ' is a minimum weight one, \nwe observe that\n', TexDisplayMathEnv('displaymath', [' ', TexNamedEnv('array', ['\n', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'), ' ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) & = &\n  ', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'), ' ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) + ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(u) \n& = & ', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'), ' ', TexCmd('cover'), '_h(u) +\n  ', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('calV'), '(G)'), ' ', TexCmd('overlinecover'), '_h(u) \n& = & ', TexCmd('mwm'), '(G_h) + ', TexCmd('mwm'), '(', TexCmd('overlineG'), '_h) & ', TexCmd('mbox', [BraceGroup('by Fact~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fact-dual')]))]), '\n', '& = & ', TexCmd('mwm'), '(G). & ', TexCmd('mbox', [BraceGroup('by Theorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('decom-thm')]))]), '\n'], [BraceGroup('llll')]), ' '], []), '\nBy Fact~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fact-dual')]), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' is minimum.\n'], []), '\n', '\nBy Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma-cover-decompose')]), ', a minimum weight cover of\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' can be computed using a recursive procedure similar to ', TexCmd('compmwm'), ' \nas follows.\n\n', TexCmd('newcommand', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('cocover')), BraceGroup(TexCmd('cover'), '^', TexCmd('Delta'))]), '\n', '\n', TexCmd('noindent', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('bf'), ' Procedure')]), ' ', TexCmd('compcov'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G)'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('theorem', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('thm-min-cover')]), '\n', TexCmd('compcov'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G)'], []), ' correctly computes a minimum weight cover of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' in\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), 'W/k(n, W/N))'], []), ' time.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', ['\nThe correctness of ', TexCmd('compcov'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G)'], []), ' follows\nfrom Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma-cover-decompose')]), '.\nFor the time complexity,\nthe analysis is similar to that of Theorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('time_for_MWM')]), '.\n'], []), '\n', '\nNow, we show how to recover a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '\nfrom a minimum weight cover ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion')], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\n\n', TexCmd('noindent', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('bf'), ' Procedure')]), ' ', TexCmd('recmwm'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G, ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), ')'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('theorem', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('thm-extract-matching')]), '\n', TexCmd('recmwm'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G,D)'], []), ' correctly computes a maximum\nweight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), 'm/k(n,m))'], []), ' time.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', ['\nThe running time of ', TexCmd('recmwm'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G,D)'], []), '\nis dominated by the construction of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K'], []), '.\nSince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ' has at most ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['2n'], []), ' nodes and at most \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['3m'], []), ' edges, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K'], []), ' can be constructed in\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('n')]), 'm/k(n,m))'], []), ' time using \nFeder-Motwani algorithm ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('FederM95')]), '.\n\nIt remains to show that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K^a'], []), ' is a maximum weight matching\nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nFirst, we argue that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ' has a perfect matching.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' be a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nBy Fact~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fact-dual')]), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) + ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(v) = w(u, v)'], []), '\nfor every edge ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M'], []), '.\nTherefore, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' is also a matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['U'], []), ' be the set of nodes in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H'], []), ' unmatched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), '.\nBy Fact~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fact-dual')]), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) = 0'], []), ' for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u ', TexCmd('in'), ' U'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['Q'], []), ' be ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\{', ' u^au^b ', TexCmd('mid'), ' u ', TexCmd('in'), ' U ', '\\}'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M^a = ', '\\{', ' u^av^a ', TexCmd('mid'), ' uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M ', '\\}'], []), '\nand ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M^b = ', '\\{', ' u^bv^b ', TexCmd('mid'), ' uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M ', '\\}'], []), '.\nNote that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['Q ', TexCmd('cup'), ' M^a ', TexCmd('cup'), ' M^b'], []), ' forms a matching in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ' and\nevery node in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ' is matched by\neither ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['Q'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M^a'], []), ' or ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M^b'], []), '.\nThus, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ' has a perfect matching.\n\nSince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K'], []), ' is a maximum cardinality matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K'], []), ' must be a perfect matching.\nFor every node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) > 0'], []), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^a'], []), ' must be matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K'], []), '.\nSince there is no edge between ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^a'], []), ' and any ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x^b'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H^', BraceGroup('ab')], []), ',\nthere exists some ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v^a'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^av^a ', TexCmd('in'), ' K'], []), '.\nThus,\nevery node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) > 0'], []), ' must be\nmatched by some edge in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K^a'], []), '.\nTherefore, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' K^a'), ' w(u, v) =\n', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' X ', TexCmd('cup'), ' Y, ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u)>0'), ' ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) =\n', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('u ', TexCmd('in'), ' X ', TexCmd('cup'), ' Y'), ' ', TexCmd('coverUnion'), '(u) =\n', TexCmd('mwm'), '(G)'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['K^a'], []), ' is a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section', [BraceGroup('All-cavity maximum weight matchings')]), '\n', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('section-maximum-all-cavity-matching')]), '\nIn ', TexCmd('S'), TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec_unfold')]), ', we introduce the notion of an ', BraceGroup(TexCmd('em'), ' unfolded graph'), '.\nIn ', TexCmd('S'), TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec_cavity_alg')]), ', we use this notion\nto design an algorithm which,\ngiven a weighted bipartite graph ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' and\na maximum weight matching of \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ', computes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' for all nodes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' using ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(W)'], []), ' time.\n\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('Unfolded graphs')]), ' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec_unfold')]), '\nThe ', BraceGroup(TexCmd('em'), ' unfolded graph'), '\\/', ' ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '\nis defined as follows.  \n', TexNamedEnv('itemize', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\nSee Figure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('Example2')]), '(a) for an example.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' be a matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.  Consider ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' as a weighted bipartite graph;\nthen, by definition, \n', TexMathEnv('math', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)=', TexCmd('bigcup'), '_', BraceGroup('uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M'), ' ', '\\{', '\nu^1v^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), ', \n', TexCmd('cdots'), ',u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), 'v^1 ', TexCmd('mid'), ' ', TexCmd('beta'), ' = w(u, v)', '\\}'], []), ' \nis a matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.  \nThe number of edges in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '\nis equal to the total weight of the edges in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ',\ni.e., ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)| = ', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M'), 'w(u,v)'], []), '.\nThe next lemma  relates ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.  \n\n', TexNamedEnv('figure', ['\n', TexNamedEnv('center', ['\n', TexCmd('epsfig', [BraceGroup('figure=kao_36120_unfolded-graph.eps, width=0.7', TexCmd('textwidth'))]), '\n'], []), '\n', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('(a) The unfolded graph ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), ' of\nthe bipartite graph given in Figure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('Example1')]), '(a).\n(b) With respect to the cover ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['C_h'], []), '\ndefined in Figure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('Example1')]), '(c),\nthe node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y_1'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), ' is the only node satisfying\nthe condition that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['1 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' C_h(y)'], []), '.  Thus,\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('H')], []), ' comprises only the edges incident to ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y_1'], []), '.')]), '\n', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('Example2')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('lemma', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('lemma_M_fi')]), ' \nAssume that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' is a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.  \n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', [' Statement ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('corollary_f(M)_1')]), ' follows from Statement\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma_f(M)_1')]), '. Statement ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma_f(M)_1')]), ' is proved as follows.\nSince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' is a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ',  \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G) = ', TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('uv ', TexCmd('in'), ' M'), ' w(u,v) = |', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)| ', TexCmd('le'), ' ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), '.\nBy Fact~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fact-dual')]), ', \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), ' if and only if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwc'), '(G) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' ', TexCmd('mwc'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), '.\nWe prove the latter as follows.\nGiven a minimum weight cover ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['C'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ',\nwe can obtain a cover ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'"], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ' as follows.\nFor any node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(u^i) = 1"], []), ' if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['C(u) >0'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['i ', TexCmd('le'), ' C(u)'], []), ';\notherwise, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C'(u^i) = 0"], []), '.\nNote that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["w(C') = w(C) = ", TexCmd('mwc'), '(G)'], []), '.  \nTherefore, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwc'), '(G) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' ', TexCmd('mwc'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), ' and\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G) ', TexCmd('ge'), ' ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), '.\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('An algorithm for all-cavity maximum weight matchings')]), TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec_cavity_alg')]), '\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' be a given maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\n\nBy Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma_M_fi')]), '(', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('corollary_f(M)_1')]), '),\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' is a maximum cardinality matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.\nIn light of this maximality, we say \nthat a path in\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), ' is ', BraceGroup(TexCmd('it'), ' alternating'), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' if (1) its edges alternate between\nbeing in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' and being not in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' and (2) \nin the case the first (respectively, last) node is matched\nby ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ', the path contains the matched edge of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), '\nas the first (respectively, last) edge.\nThe length of an alternating path is its number of edges.\nAn alternating path may have zero length; in this case,\nthe path contains exactly one unmatched node.\nAn alternating path ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' can modify ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' to another\nmatching, i.e., ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(', TexCmd('phi'), '(M) ', TexCmd('cup'), ' P) - (', TexCmd('phi'), '(M) ', TexCmd('cap'), ' P)'], []), '.\nIf ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' is of even length, the resulting matching has the\nsame size as ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nIf ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' is of odd length, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' modifies ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), '\nto a strictly smaller or bigger matching; yet the latter is impossible\nbecause ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' is maximum.\nIntuitively, we would like to maximize the size of\nthe resultant matching and even-length alternating\npaths are preferred.\n\nOur new algorithm for computing ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' \nis based on the observation that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' can be determined \nby detecting the smallest ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['i'], []), ' such that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' has an\neven-length alternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.  Details are as follows.\n\nDefinition.\nFor each ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ', let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ' if there is an\neven-length alternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' starting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ';\notherwise, let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 1'], []), '.  \n\n\nThe following lemma states a monotone property\nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)'], []), ' over different ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['i'], []), "'s.\n\n", TexNamedEnv('lemma', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('disjoin-path')]), '\nConsider any node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^1, u^2, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta'))], []), ' be its corresponding nodes in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.\nIf ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ', then \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^j) = 0'], []), ' for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j ', TexCmd('in', [BracketGroup('i,', TexCmd('beta'))])], []), '.\nFurthermore, there exist  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('beta'), ' - i + 1'], []), ' node-disjoint\neven-length alternating paths ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_i, P_', BraceGroup('i+1'), ',', TexCmd('ldots'), ' P_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta'))], []), ' for\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ', where each ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_j'], []), ' starts from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^j'], []), '.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', [' \nAs ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ',\nlet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_i = u_0^', BraceGroup('a_0'), ', v_0^', BraceGroup('b_0'), ','], []), '\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_1^', BraceGroup('a_1'), ', v_1^', BraceGroup('b_1'), ', ', TexCmd('ldots'), ',\nu_', BraceGroup('p-1'), '^', BraceGroup('a_', BraceGroup('p-1')), ', v_', BraceGroup('p-1'), '^', BraceGroup('b_', BraceGroup('p-1')), ', u_p^', BraceGroup('a_p')], []), ' \nbe a shortest even-length alternating path\nfor ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_0^', BraceGroup('a_0'), ' = u^', BraceGroup('i')], []), '.\n\nBased on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_i'], []), ', we can construct\nan even-length alternating path ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_', BraceGroup('i+1')], []), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '\nstarting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^', BraceGroup('i+1')], []), ' as follows.\nIf ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^', BraceGroup('i+1')], []), '  is not matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_', BraceGroup('i+1')], []), ' is simply\na path of zero length. From now on, we\nassume that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^', BraceGroup('i+1')], []), ' is matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nAs ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' is of even length, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_p^', BraceGroup('a_p')], []), ' is not matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nThen, by the definition of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ', \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_p^', BraceGroup('a_p+1')], []), ' is also not matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['h'], []), ' be the smallest integer in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['[', '1,p', ']'], []), '\nsuch that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_h^', BraceGroup('a_h+1')], []), ' is not matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nNotice that, for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), ' < h'], []), ',\n ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_', TexCmd('ell'), '^', BraceGroup('a_', TexCmd('ell'), '+1')], []), ' is matched to ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v_', TexCmd('ell'), '^', BraceGroup('b_', TexCmd('ell'), '-1')], []), ';\nfurthermore, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ' contains an edge\nbetween ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v_', TexCmd('ell'), '^', BraceGroup('b_', TexCmd('ell'), '-1')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('ell'), '+1'), '^', BraceGroup('a_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('ell'), '+1'), '+1')], []), '.\nThus, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_', BraceGroup('i+1'), ' = u^', BraceGroup('i+1'), ', v_0^', BraceGroup('b_0-1'), ',\nu_1^', BraceGroup('a_1+1'), ', v_1^', BraceGroup('b_1-1'), ','], []), ' ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('cdots'), ', u_h^', BraceGroup('a_h+1')], []), '\nis an even-length alternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nSimilarly, \nfor ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j = i+2, ', TexCmd('cdots'), ', ', TexCmd('beta')], []), ', we can use\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_i'], []), ' to define an\neven-length alternating path ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_j'], []), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '\nstarting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^j'], []), '.\nBy construction,  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_i, P_', BraceGroup('i+1'), ', ', TexCmd('cdots'), ' P_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta'))], []), '\nare node-disjoint.\n'], []), '\n', '\nThe next lemma is the basis of our cavity matching algorithm.\nIt shows that given ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G)'], []), ' ', '(i.e., the\nweight of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), '),\nwe can compute ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' \nfrom the values ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)'], []), ', and all the ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)'], []), "'s\ncan be found in ", TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(W)'], []), ' time.\n\n', TexNamedEnv('lemma', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('lemma-weighted-cavity')]), '\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', ['\nThe two statements are proved as follows.\n\nStatement~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('stmt-cavity')]), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), ' be the largest integer such that\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^k) = 1'], []), '.  By Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('disjoin-path')]), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)=1'], []), ' for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['1', TexCmd('leq'), ' i ', TexCmd('leq'), ' k'], []), ', and\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0'], []), ' otherwise. Note that if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)=1'], []), ', \n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' must be matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nThus, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('sum'), '_', BraceGroup('1 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' i ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('beta')), TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = k'], []), '.\nBelow, we prove the following two equalities:\n', TexNamedEnv('itemize', ['\n', TexCmd('item', [BracketGroup('(1)')]), TexCmd('item', [BracketGroup('(2)')])], []), '\nThen, by Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma_M_fi')]), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G) = ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ')'], []), ' and\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ') = ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), ' - ', '\\{', 'u^1, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), '\\}', ')'], []), '.\nThus,  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G)-', TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')=k'], []), ' and Statement~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('stmt-cavity')]), ' follows.\n\nTo show Equality (1),\nlet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['H'], []), ' be the set of edges of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' incident to\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['1 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' i ', TexCmd('leq'), ' k'], []), '.  Let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M' = ", TexCmd('phi'), '(M) - H'], []), '.\nThen, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["|M'|=|", TexCmd('phi'), '(M)|-k'], []), '.\nWe claim that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M'"], []), ' is a maximum cardinality matching of\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)-', '\\{', 'u^1,...,u^k', '\\}'], []), '.\nHence, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(', TexCmd('phi'), '(G)-', '\\{', 'u^1,...,u^k', '\\}', ') =\n|', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)| -k'], []), ', and Equality (1) follows.\nWe prove the claim by contradiction.\nSuppose ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M'"], []), ' is not a maximum cardinality matching of\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG'), ' - ', '\\{', 'u^1, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^k ', '\\}'], []), '.\nThen, there exists an alternating path ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' that \ncan modify ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M'"], []), ' to a larger matching \nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG'), ' - ', '\\{', 'u^1, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^k ', '\\}'], []), ' ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Galil86,Gerards95')]), ';\nin particular, the length of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' must be odd and\nboth of its endpoints are not matched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M'"], []), '.\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' must start from some node\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v^j'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^iv^j ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['i < k'], []), ';\notherwise, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), ' is alternating for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '\nand ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' cannot be a maximum cardinality matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['Q'], []), ' be a path formed by joining ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^iv^j'], []), ' with\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P'], []), '. ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['Q'], []), ' is an even-length alternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '\nstarting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG')], []), '.\nThis contradicts the fact that there is no even-length alternating\npath for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' starting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['i < k'], []), '.\n\nTo show Equality (2),  we first note that \n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), '\\}', ') ', TexCmd('leq'), ' \n     ', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^k', '\\}', ')'], []), '.\nIt remains to prove the other direction.\nBy Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('disjoin-path')]), ',\nwe can find\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('beta'), ' - k'], []), ' node-disjoint even-length alternating \npaths ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_', BraceGroup('k+1'), ', ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', P_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta'))], []), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ', which\nstart from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^', BraceGroup('k+1'), ', ', TexCmd('cdots'), ', u^', TexCmd('beta')], []), '.\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['P_j'], []), ' starts at ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^j'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M'' = (", TexCmd('phi'), '(M) ', TexCmd('cup'), ' ', '(P_', BraceGroup('j+1'), ' ', TexCmd('cup'), ' ', TexCmd('cdots'), ' ', TexCmd('cup'), '\nP_', TexCmd('beta'), ')) - (', TexCmd('phi'), '(M) ', TexCmd('cap'), ' ', '(P_', BraceGroup('j+1'), ' ', TexCmd('cup'), ' ', TexCmd('cdots'), ' ', TexCmd('cup'), ' P_', TexCmd('beta'), '))'], []), '.\nNote that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["|M''| = |", TexCmd('phi'), '(M)|'], []), ' and\nthere are no edges in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M''"], []), ' incident to any \nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^', BraceGroup('k+1'), ', ', TexCmd('cdots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta'))], []), '.\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M''"], []), ' is a matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^', BraceGroup('k+1'), ', ', TexCmd('cdots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), '\\}'], []), ' and\n ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["M''-H"], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), '\\}'], []), '.\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["|M''-H| ", TexCmd('geq'), " |M''|-k = |", TexCmd('phi'), '(M)|-k'], []), '.  Since\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1, ', TexCmd('ldots'), ', u^k', '\\}', ') = |', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)| -k'], []), ' by Equality (1),\nit follows that\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',u^', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), '\\}', ') ', TexCmd('ge'), " |M''-H| ", TexCmd('ge'), '\n', TexCmd('mm'), '(', TexCmd('fG'), '-', '\\{', 'u^1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',u^k', '\\}', ')'], []), '.  Therefore, Equality (2) holds.\n\n\nStatement~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('stmt-find-even')]), '.\nWe want to determine \nwhether ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ' for all nodes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(W)'], []), ' time.\nBy definition, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ' if and only if\nthere is an even-length \nalternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' starting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), '.\nLet us partition the nodes of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ' into two parts:\n ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(X) = ', '\\{', 'u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(G) ', TexCmd('mid'), ' u ', TexCmd('in'), ' X', '\\}'], []), ' and\n ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(Y) = ', '\\{', 'u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(G) ', TexCmd('mid'), ' u ', TexCmd('in'), ' Y', '\\}'], []), '.\nBelow, we give the details of computing\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i)'], []), ' for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(X)'], []), '.\nThe case where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(Y)'], []), ' is symmetric.\n\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' be a directed graph over the node set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(X)'], []), '.\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' contains an edge ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^iv^j'], []), ' if there exists a node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w^k ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(Y)'], []), ' \nsuch that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^iw^k ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(G) - ', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['w^kv^j ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nConsider any node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v^j'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' that is unmatched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nA directed path in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['v^j'], []), ' to a node ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), '\ncorresponds to a path in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(G)'], []), ', which is indeed\nan even-length alternating path for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), ' starting from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), '.  \nTherefore,\nfor any ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('phi'), '(X)'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '(u^i) = 0'], []), ' if and only if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' is\nreachable from some node in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' that is unmatched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('phi'), '(M)'], []), '.\nWe can identify all such ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u^i'], []), ' by using a depth-first search \non ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' starting with all the nodes unmatched by ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), '.\nThe time required is ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(|D|)'], []), '.  As ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|D| ', TexCmd('leq'), ' |', TexCmd('phi'), '(G)| = W'], []), ',\nthe lemma follows.\n'], []), '\n', '\nThe following procedure computes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G-', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' for all nodes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['M'], []), ' be a maximum weight matching of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), '.\n\n', TexCmd('noindent', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('bf'), ' Procedure')]), '  ', TexCmd('compallcavity'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G,M)'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n ', '\n', TexNamedEnv('theorem', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('time_for_all-cavity')]), '\n', TexCmd('compallcavity'), TexMathModeEnv('$', ['(G,M)'], []), ' correctly computes ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mwm'), '(G - ', '\\{', 'u', '\\}', ')'], []), ' for all\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['G'], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['O(W)'], []), ' time.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('proof', ['\nFollows from Lemma~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('lemma-weighted-cavity')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section*', [BraceGroup('Acknowledgments')]), '\nThe authors wish to thank the anonymous referee for extremely helpful\ncomments, which significantly improved the presentation of the paper.\nIn particular, Theorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('decom-thm')]), ' was originally proved using\nunfolded graphs (see the conference version of this paper\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('klst.mat.scp')]), '); the new proof is based on a suggestion by the\nreferee.\n\n\n', TexNamedEnv('thebibliography', ['\n', '\n', TexCmd('bibitem', [BraceGroup('BM76'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sc'), ' J.~Bondy and U.~Murty')]), ', ', BraceGroup(TexCmd('em'), ' Graph Theory with Applications'), ',\n  North-Holland, New York, NY, 1976.\n\n', TexCmd('bibitem', [BraceGroup('Chung87'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sc'), ' M.~J. Kao, T.~W. Lam, W.~K. Sung, and H.~F. Ting')]), ', ', BraceGroup(TexCmd('em'), ' All-cavity maximum\n  matchings'), ', in Lecture Notes in Computer Science 1350: Proceedings of the 8th\n  Annual International Symposium on Algorithms and Computation, H.~Imai and\n  H.~W.
