We also compare our results with the modified\n  compressed sensing approach proposed in\n  ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), '.\n\n\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('Weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization with estimated support')]), '\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['T_0'], []), ' be the support of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x_k'], []), ', and let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ', the\nsupport estimate, be a\nsubset of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\{', '1,2,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',N', '\\}'], []), ' with cardinality ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k_1 := |', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '|\n= ', TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), ', where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('rho'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' a'], []), ' for some ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a > 1'], []), '. As before, we wish to recover an arbitrary vector ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('R'), '^N'], []), ' from\nnoisy compressive measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y = Ax + e'], []), ', where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['e'], []), ' satisfies\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\|', 'e', '\\|', '_2 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('epsilon')], []), '. To recover ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('R'), '^N'], []), ', we now consider the\nweighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization problem with the following choice of weights:\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), '\n  ', TexCmd('minim'), '_', BraceGroup('z'), ' ', '\\|', 'z', '\\|', '_', BraceGroup('1,', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])), ' ', TexCmd('text', [BraceGroup('subject to')]), ' ', '\\|', 'Az - y', '\\|', '_2 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('epsilon'), '\n  ', TexCmd('quad'), TexCmd('text', [BraceGroup('with')]), TexCmd('quad'), '\n  ', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')]), '_i = \n  ', TexNamedEnv('cases', ['\n      1,      & i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c,\n    ', TexCmd('omega'), ', & i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '. \n  '], []), '\n'], []), '\nHere, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' 1'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\|', 'z', '\\|', '_', BraceGroup('1,', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')]))], []), ' is as defined\nin (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_0')]), '). Our main result follows.\n\n', TexNamedEnv('thm', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), '\n  Let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' be in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('R'), '^N'], []), ' and let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x_k'], []), ' be its best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-term\n  approximation, supported on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['T_0'], []), '.  Let\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), TexCmd('subset'), '\\{', '1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',N', '\\}'], []), ' be an arbitrary set and define\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' as before such that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '|=', TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), ' and\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0| = ', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), '.  Suppose that there\n  exists an ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('1'), BraceGroup('k')]), TexCmd('Z')], []), ', with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a ', TexCmd('geq'), ' ', '(1-', TexCmd('alpha'), ')', TexCmd('rho')], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a>1'], []), ',\n  and the measurement matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' has RIP with\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:suff_wl1')]), '\n', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('ak'), ' + ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('a'), BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), '-2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))]), ')^2')]), TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'), ' < ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('a'), BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), '-2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))]), ')^2')]), ' - 1, \n'], []), '\nfor some given ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' 1'], []), '.  Then the solution ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x^*'], []), ' to (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), ') obeys\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_recovery')]), '\n\t', '\\|', 'x^* - x', '\\|', '_2 ', TexCmd('leq'), " C_0'", TexCmd('epsilon'), " + C_1'k^", BraceGroup('-1/2'), '(', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x - x_k', '\\|', '_1 + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1),\n'], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0'"], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' are well-behaved constants that depend on the measurement matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ', the weight ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ', and the parameters ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho')], []), '.\n'], []), '\n The proof of the theorem is presented in section ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec:Proof')]), '.\n ', TexNamedEnv('rem', [' Note that the parameters in\n   Theorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' specify two important\n   ratios: ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho')], []), ' determines the ratio of the size of the estimated\n   support to the size of the actual support of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x_k'], []), ' ', '(or the support\n   of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' is ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-sparse). On the other hand, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' determines\n   the ratio of the number of indices in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('supp'), '(x_k)'], []), ' that were\n   accurately estimated in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ' to the size of\n   ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), '. Specifically, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0|'), BraceGroup('|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '|')])], []), '.\n'], []), '\n', TexNamedEnv('rem', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('rem:const')]), '\nThe constants ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0'"], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' are explicitly given by the expressions\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_constants')]), '\n', TexNamedEnv('array', ["\n\tC_0' = ", TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('textstyle'), ' 2(1+', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('omega'), ' +\n              (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), '-2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))])), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('a')]))]), ')'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('textstyle'), TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1-', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'))]), '\n          - ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('omega'), ' +\n            (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), '-2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))])), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('a')]))]), TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('ak'))]))]), ",&\n        C_1' = ", TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('textstyle'), ' 2\n          a^', BraceGroup('-1/2'), '(', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1-', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'))]), ' +\n            ', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('ak'))]), ') '), BraceGroup(TexCmd('textstyle'), ' ', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1-', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'))]), ' - ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), '-2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))])), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('a')]))]), TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('ak'))]))]), '.\n'], [BraceGroup('ll')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexCmd('noindent'), ' Consequently, Theorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ', with\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '=1'], []), ', reduces to the stable and robust recovery theorem of\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('CRT05')]), ', which we stated above---see\nTheorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:L1_recovery')]), '.\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('rem', [' It is sufficient that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' satisfies\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'), ' < ', TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('delta'))]), '^', BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ')'), ' := ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('a - (', TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), ' - 2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))]), ')^2'), BraceGroup('a + (', TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), ' - \t\t\t2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))]), ')^2')]), '\n'], []), '\nfor Theorem ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' to hold, i.e., to guarantee\nstable and robust recovery of the signal ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' from measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y = Ax\n+ e'], []), ' ', '(with constants ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0'"], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' given in\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_constants')]), ' and ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), ').\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('rem', ['\n  Theorems ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:L1_recovery')]), ' and ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), '\n  guarantee stable and robust recovery for matrices ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' satisfying a\n  condition on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k')], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a > 1'], []), '. A slightly different\n  approach was used by Cand', BraceGroup('\\`', 'e'), 's ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('candes2008rip')]), ' to handle the\n  case ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a=1'], []), '. Cand', BraceGroup('\\`', 'e'), 's proved that if ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k'), ' <\n  (', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('2')]), '+1)^', BraceGroup('-1')], []), ', then ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:L1_min')]), ')\n  achieves stable and robust recovery. Following the same technique,\n  with appropriate modifications to handle the weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\n  objective, we can derive the analogous alternative sufficient\n  condition\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_2k_RIP')]), '\n', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k'), ' < (', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('2')]), '(', TexCmd('omega'), ' + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('1+', TexCmd('rho'), ' - 2', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'))]), ') + 1)^', BraceGroup('-1'), ',\n'], []), '\nwhich guarantees stable and robust recovery using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\nminimization (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), '). We omit the details of this\ncalculation.\n'], []), '  \n', '\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('Comparison to standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery')]), TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec:Compare_with_L1')]), '\nIn this section, we compare the sufficient conditions for\nTheorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' and\nTheorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:L1_recovery')]), ' as well as the associated constants of\nthese two theorems. The following observation is easy to verify.\n', TexNamedEnv('prop', [' Let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0,C_1,C_0'"], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' be as above. Then\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], [BracketGroup('(i)')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n ', '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup(), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=3.2in'), BraceGroup('RIP_constant_v_weights.pdf')]), '\t')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('mbox', [BraceGroup('\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup(), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=3.2in'), BraceGroup('C0_v_weights.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup(), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=3.2in'), BraceGroup('C1_v_weights.pdf')]))]), '\n\t')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Comparison of the sufficient conditions for recovery\n          and stability constants for weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\n          reconstruction with various of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), '. In all the figures,\n          we set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a=3'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '=1'], []), '. (a) ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('delta'))]), '^', BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ')')], []), '\n          vs. ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ', (b) ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0'"], []), ' vs. ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ', (c) ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), '\n          vs. ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), '. In (b) and (c) we fix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k'), ' = 0.1'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:RIP_C0_C1_v_weights')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('t')]), '\n', '\nNext, we illustrate how the slightly stronger sufficient conditions\ngiven in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), ' and the respective stability\nconstants vary with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), '. Recall that when\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '=1'], []), ', ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), ' reduces to\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:L1_RIP')]), '. In Figure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:RIP_C0_C1_v_weights')]), ' ', '(a), we\nplot, for different values of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('delta'))]), '^', BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ')')], []), ' as\ndefined in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), ', versus ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ', where we set\nthe parameter ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a=3'], []), '. We observe that as ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' increases the\nsufficient condition on the RIP constant becomes weaker, allowing for\na wider class of measurement matrices ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), '. For example, with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a=3'], []), ',\nwhen ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['70 percent '], []), ' of the support estimate is accurate, with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '=0.2'], []), ' it\nsuffices to have ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat'), TexCmd('delta'), '^', BraceGroup('(', TexCmd('omega'), ')'), '<0.763'], []), ', compared with\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat'), TexCmd('delta'), '^', BraceGroup('(1)'), '<0.5'], []), ' for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization. Figures\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:RIP_C0_C1_v_weights')]), ' ', '(b) and (c) illustrate that for a fixed\nmatrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ', the constants ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_0'"], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' decrease as ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), '\nincreases. Note that compared to setting ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '=0'], []), ', assigning non-zero weights\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' adds robustness to the weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' problem in the case\nwhen ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' < 0.5'], []), ', i.e., when we have an inaccurate support estimate\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ' with more than half the entries falling outside the\nsupport of the best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-term approximation of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), '. This could be\nbeneficial in applications where the accuracy of the support estimates\nvary significantly from one signal to the next. Furthermore, in\nnumerical experiments (see Section~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec:Simulations')]), ') we observe\nthat using non-zero weights improves the quality of the\nreconstruction, especially in the noisy and compressible settings, not\nonly when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' < 0.5'], []), ' but also in some cases where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), '>0.5'], []), '. A\nmathematical understanding of this behavior and of how to optimally\nchoose the weight ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' is beyond the scope of this paper.\n\n\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('The zero weight case: ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '=0'], []))]), '\n', '\nOne special case of the weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' problem that is of interest\nis the zero weight case, i.e., set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' in\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), '. It can be seen from\nFigure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:RIP_C0_C1_v_weights')]), ' that recovery using weighted\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), ') achieves the smallest\nerror bound constants at ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' > 0.5'], []), '. On the\nother hand, the recovery performance is worst when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' and\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' < 0.5'], []), ', i.e., when the support estimate is highly inaccurate.\n\nSeveral contributions in the literature adopt the zero-weight approach,\nmainly in applications where prior support information is assumed to\nbe highly accurate, i.e., ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' is close to 1, e.g., see\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('CS_using_PI_Borries:2007, Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010,\n  modified_BPDN_Vaswani:2010')]), '. The most recent study to address this\nproblem is the work by Vaswani and Lu\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), ' where a sufficient condition in\nterms of the RIP of the matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' is derived for exact recovery in\nthe noise free case. Another work by the same authors\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('modified_BPDN_Vaswani:2010')]), ' addresses the noisy case, however,\nthe recovery algorithm in this case is different from\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), ' in that the objective function is modified to\ninclude a regularization term. The sufficient condition derived in\nCorollary 1 of ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), ' is expressed as\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), '\n 2', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2u'), ' + ', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('3u'), ' + ', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('k'), ' + ', TexCmd('delta'), '^2_', BraceGroup('k+u'), ' + 2', TexCmd('delta'), '^2_', BraceGroup('k + 2u'), ' < 1,\n'], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u = (1-', TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'), ')k'], []), ' is the size of the unkown support. Recall that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' is such that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), ' is the size of the known support.\n\nBelow we compare our condition ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_2k_RIP')]), ' with that of\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), ' given in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' for\ndifferent values of the unknown support size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), '. We consider the case\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), ' = 1'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u > 0'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n/N = 0.5'], []), '. Thus, ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_2k_RIP')]), '\nreduces to \n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [' ', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), '\n', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k'), ' < ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('1'), BraceGroup('2', TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup('u/k')]), ' + 1')]), '. \n'], []), '\nSince the two sufficient\nconditions, i.e., ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), ' and ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ', are expressed in terms of RIP constants of different-sized\nsubmatrices of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ', a simple comparison of the upper bounds is not\ninformative. For this reeason, we restrict our attention to\nmeasurement matrices drawn from the Gaussian ensemble and we estimate\nthe associated RIP constants (i.e., ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k'), ',', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2u'), ',', TexCmd('dots')], []), ')\nfor such matrices using the bounds derived in ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Bah_Tanner_RIPbounds:2010')]), '.\nIn particular, we calculate the ratios ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u/k'], []), ' that satisfy the\nconditions ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' and ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), ',\nrespectively, and plot the results in Figure\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:uk_vs_kn')]), '. Observe that for the same measurement matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), '\nand sparsity level ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k/n'], []), ', our sufficient condition guarantees the\nrecovery of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-sparse signals with significantly less accurate prior\nsupport information compared to the condition of Vaswani et\nal. ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), '.\n', TexNamedEnv('figure', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=4.5in'), BraceGroup('SuffCond_uk_vs_kn.pdf')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Comparison between the values of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u/k'], []), ' that satisfy\n          each of the sufficient conditions ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' and\n          ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), '. The measurement matrix has Gaussian\n          entries with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n/N = 0.5'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:uk_vs_kn')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('t')]), ' \n', '\nIt is clear in Figure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:uk_vs_kn')]), ' that our recovery\nguarantees are superior to those of ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), '\nat least when the aspect ratio of the measurement matrix is\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n/N=0.5'], []), '. Next, we shall focus on cases where we have a highly\naccurate estimate of the full support of the ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-sparse vector ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), '. In\nother words, we set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), '=1'], []), ' as above and consider values of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), '\nthat are close to 1. For these cases, we will compare our theoretical\nguarantees to those of ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), ' for various\nvalues of the measurement matrix aspect ratio. To that end, we observe\nthat the left-hand side of ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' is increasing in\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), '. Thus, for any ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ', ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' can hold only if\n', TexDisplayMathModeEnv('$$', ['\n', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('k'), ' + 3', TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('k'), '^2 < 1 ', TexCmd('implies'), ' ', TexCmd('delta'), '_k < 0.4343, \n'], []), '\nwhich is obtained by setting ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u=0'], []), ' in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), ' and\nobserving that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_0=0'], []), ' by definition. On the other hand, using\nthe bounds from ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Bah_Tanner_RIPbounds:2010')]), ', we can estimate\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k')], []), ' and find the corresponding range of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u'], []), ' for\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), ' to hold in the case when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' is a Gaussian\nrandom matrix. The upper bound on the range of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u/k'], []), ' for various aspect\nratios of the measurement matrix is reported in\nTable~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('tab:RIPrecoveryGuarantee')]), '. We conclude that in various\ncases with different measurement matrix aspect ratios our theoretical\nresults guarantee recovery while the results of\n', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Vaswani_Lu_Modified-CS:2010')]), ' fail to provide any recovery\nguarantee.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n', TexNamedEnv('table', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t\t', TexNamedEnv('tabular', ['\n\t\t', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t', TexCmd('textbf', [BraceGroup('n/N')]), ' ', '& ', TexCmd('textbf', [BraceGroup('k/n')]), ' ', '& ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mathbf', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('delta'), '_k')])], []), ' ', '& ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mathbf', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('2k'))])], []), ' ', '& ', TexCmd('textbf', [BraceGroup('u/k')]), '  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t0.1 & 0.0029 & 0.4343 & 0.6153 & 0.0978  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t0.2 & 0.0031 & 0.4343 & 0.6139 & 0.0989  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\t\n\t\t0.3 & 0.003218 & 0.4343 & 0.61176 & 0.1007  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t0.4 & 0.003315 & 0.4343 & 0.61077 & 0.1015  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t0.5 & 0.003394 & 0.4343 & 0.60989 & 0.1023  ', TexCmd('hline'), '\n\t\t'], [BraceGroup('|c|c|c|c|c|')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Maximum unknown support size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u/k'], []), ' for which\n         ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), ' holds while ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:VaswaniRIC')]), '\n          fails to hold. For a given aspect ratio ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n/N'], []), ', we compute\n          the value of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k/n'], []), ' for which ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_k=0.4343'], []), '. This value,\n          using ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:red_suff_u')]), ', yields the corresponding bound on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['u/k'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('tab:RIPrecoveryGuarantee')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('t')]), '\n', '\n', '\n', '\n', '\nWe finish this section by comparing the recovery guarantees we obtain\nin the zero-weight case with conditions that guarantee recovery via\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization without using any prior support information. To\nthis end, we present the phase diagrams of measurement matrices ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), '\nwith Gaussian entries that satisfy the conditions on the restricted\nisometry constants ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('(a+1)k')], []), ' given in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:L1_RIP')]), ' and\n', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1_RIP')]), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ', respectively. We use the\nbounds derived in ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Bah_Tanner_RIPbounds:2010')]), ' and plot the curves\nin Figure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:phase_diagrams')]), ' for matrices satisfying the\nsufficient conditions on ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('delta'), '_', BraceGroup('4k')], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), ' = 1'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' =\n0.3'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0.6'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0.8'], []), '.\n', TexNamedEnv('figure', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=4.5in'), BraceGroup('phase_diagram_L1_v_wL1.pdf')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Comparison between the phase diagrams of measurement matrices with Gaussian entries satisfying the sufficient recovery conditions of standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization and weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.3'], []), ', 0.6, and 0.8. The plots are calculated using the upper bounds on the restricted isometry constants derived in ', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('Bah_Tanner_RIPbounds:2010')]), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:phase_diagrams')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('t')]), ' \n ', '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section', [BraceGroup('Numerical Examples')]), TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec:Simulations')]), '\nIn this section, we present numerical experiments that illustrate the\nbenefits of using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization to recover sparse and\ncompressible signals when partial prior support information (which is\npossibly inaccurate) is available. To that end, we compare the\nrecovery capabilities of standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' and weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\nminimization for a suite of synthetically generated sparse and\ncompressible signals. In all of our experiments, we use\nSPGL1~', TexCmd('cite', [BraceGroup('BergFriedlander:2008, spgl1:2007')]), ' to solve the standard\nand weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization problems.\n\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('The sparse case')]), '\nWe first generate signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with an ambient dimension ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), ' and\nfixed sparsity ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 40'], []), '. We compute the (noisy) compressed measurements of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), '\nusing a Gaussian random measurement matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A'], []), ' with dimensions ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n ', TexCmd('times'), '\nN'], []), ' where we vary ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n'], []), ' between 80 and 200 with an increment of\n20. In the experiments where the measurements are noisy, we set\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('epsilon'), '=', '\\|', 'x', '\\|', '_2/20'], []), '. \n\n\nFigure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_n')]), ' shows the average reconstruction signal\nto noise ratio (SNR) over 20 experiments when using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\nminimization depending on the number of measurements, both in the noise-free and\nnoisy cases. The SNR is\nmeasured in dB and is given by\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', ['\n\t', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('SNR')]), '(x,x^*) = 10', TexCmd('log'), '_', BraceGroup('10'), '(', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('\\|', 'x', '\\|', '_2^2'), BraceGroup('\\|', 'x - x^*', '\\|', '_2^2')]), '),\n'], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' is the true signal and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x^*'], []), ' is the recovered signal. The\nrecovery is done via ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), ' using a support estimate\nof size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '| = 40'], []), ' ', '(i.e., ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), ' = 1'], []), ') where\n', TexNamedEnv('itemize', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\n', '\nFigure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_n')]), ' ', '(a) illustrates that in the noise\nfree case, the experimental results are consistent with the\ntheoretical bounds derived in Theorem\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), '. More specifically, it can be seen that\nwhen ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' ', TexCmd('geq'), ' 0.5'], []), ' the best recovery is achieved for a weight\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' whereas a ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 1'], []), ' results in the worst SNR. On the\nother hand, when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' < 0.5'], []), ' the performance of the recovery\nalgorithms is shifted towards larger values of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' in the\nseverely underdetermined cases (small ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n'], []), '). Figure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_rho')]), ' shows the average recovered SNR using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization for different values of the parameter ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho')], []), '. It is evident from the figure that using a larger support estimate favours better reconstruction, However, it can be seen in both the noise free and noisy measurement vector cases that the recovery is more sensitive to the accuracy ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' of the support estimate than its size relative to ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '.\n\n\n\n', TexNamedEnv('rem', ['\nRecall from Section~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('sec:Compare_with_L1')]), '---see Figure\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:RIP_C0_C1_v_weights')]), '---that when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' is sparse and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), '\n', TexCmd('geq'), ' 0.5'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0'], []), ' results in the smallest error bound\nconstants. Otherwise, i.e., when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' < 0.5'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 1'], []), '\nminimizes the error constants. However, this does not match entirely\nwith our experimental observations. It can be seen from Figure\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_n')]), ' ', '(b) that, in general, the best recovery is\nobtained for intermediate values of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), '.\n\nTo explain this behaviour, consider the case where the measurement\nmatrix does not satisfy the RIP conditions for the full recovery of a\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '-sparse ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' via weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization. In such cases, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), '\ncan be regarded as compressible: Fix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')]), ' < k'], []), ' be such that\nTheorem ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' holds for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')])], []), '-sparse\nsignals and for all ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), TexCmd('in', [BracketGroup('0,1')])], []), '. Suppose ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ' is the\nsupport of the best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')])], []), ' term approximation of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), '. Then Theorem\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' guarantees stable and robust recovery\nof ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' where the recovery error is bounded by\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('nonumber'), '\n\t', '\\|', 'x^* - x', '\\|', '_2 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup("C_1'(", TexCmd('omega'), ')'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('sqrt', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')]))]))]), '( ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1 + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c', TexCmd('cap'), TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1),\n'], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ' is the prior support estimate. Denote by\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha'))]), ' =\n', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('|', TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), TexCmd('cap'), TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '|'), BraceGroup('|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '|')])], []), ' and note that\nsince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('subset'), ' T_0'], []), ', then ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha'))]), ' < ', TexCmd('alpha')], []), '.\nFocusing our attention on the case when ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha'))]), ' < 0.5'], []), ' ', '(where it\nis observed that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 < ', TexCmd('omega'), ' < 1'], []), ' results in the best recovery), we\nmake the following observations:\n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], [BracketGroup('(i)')]), '\nTherefore, for a fixed ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')])], []), ', there exists ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' 1'], []), ' that\nminimizes the product of the constant ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ["C_1'"], []), ' and the term\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1 +\n(1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c', TexCmd('cap'), TexCmd('widehat', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1'], []), '. Consequently,\nwhen the algorithm cannot recover the full support of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ', an\nintermediate value of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' in ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['[', '0,1', ']'], []), ' may result in the smallest\nrecovery error. A full mathematical analysis of the above observations\nneeds to take into account all the interdependencies between ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ',\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('k')])], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha'))])], []), ' as well as the parameters in\nTheorem~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]), ' and is beyond the scope of this\npaper.\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n', TexCmd('centering'), '\n', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('Noise Free'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_n_noise0prcnt.pdf')]))]), '\n', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('5 percent  Noise Variance'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_n_noise5prcnt.pdf')]))]), '\n', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Performance of weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery in terms of SNR\n  averaged over 20 experiments for sparse signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 40'], []), ',\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), ', while varying the number of measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n'], []), '. From\n  left to right, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.7'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.5'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' =\n  0.3'], []), '.')]), '\n', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_n')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n', TexCmd('centering'), '\n', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('Noise Free'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in, height=2in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rho_sparse_nonoise.pdf')]))]), '\n', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('5 percent  Noise Variance'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in, height=2in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rho_sparse_noise5prcnt.pdf')]))]), '\n', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Performance of weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery in terms of SNR\n  averaged over 20 experiments for sparse signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 40'], []), ',\n  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n = 100'], []), ' while varying the size of the support estimate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho')], []), ' as a proportion of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k'], []), '. From\n  left to right, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.7'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.5'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' =\n  0.3'], []), '.')]), '\n', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:sparse_SNR_vs_rho')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', '\n', '\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('The compressible case')]), '\nNext, we generate a signal ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' whose coefficients decay like ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j^', BraceGroup('-p')], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', '\\{', '1,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',N', '\\}'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p > 1'], []), '. In Figure\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p1.1')]), ', we illustrate the recovered\nsignal SNR versus the size of the support estimate for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p=1.1'], []), '. To\ncalculate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' we set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k=40'], []), ', i.e., we are interested in the best\n40-term approximation. Notice that on average, a weight ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '\n', TexCmd('approx'), ' 0.5'], []), ' results in the best recovery. This behavior is consistent\nwith the explanation provided above where an intermediate value of\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' balances the tradeoff between the error bound constants and\nthe norm of the off-support components. We repeat this experiment with\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p=1.5'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k=20'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p=2'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k=10'], []), '. The results are reported in Figures\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p1.5')]), ' and\n', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p2')]), ', and show the same qualitative\nbehaviour.  \n\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('Noise free'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_40_compressible_no_noise.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('10 percent  Noise Variance'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_40_compressible_noise_10prcnt.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Performance of weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery in terms of SNR averaged over 10 experiments for compressible signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n = 100'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), '. The coefficients decay with a power ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p = 1.1'], []), '. The accuracy of the support estimate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' is calculated with respect to the best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 40'], []), ' term approximation. From left to right, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.7'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.5'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.3'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p1.1')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('Noise free'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_20_compressible_no_noise_p1-5.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('10 percent  Noise Variance'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_20_compressible_noise_10prcnt_p1-5.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Performance of weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery in terms of SNR averaged over 10 experiments for compressible signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n = 100'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), '. The coefficients decay with a power ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p = 1.5'], []), '. The accuracy of the support estimate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' is calculated with respect to the best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 20'], []), ' term approximation. From left to right, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.7'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.5'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.3'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p1.5')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', '\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('Noise free'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_10_compressible_no_noise_p2.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('subfigure', [BracketGroup('10 percent  Noise Variance'), BraceGroup(TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('SNR_vs_rhoK_k_10_compressible_noise_10prcnt_p2.pdf')]))]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Performance of weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' recovery in terms of SNR averaged over 10 experiments for compressible signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n = 100'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 500'], []), '. The coefficients decay with a power ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['p = 2'], []), '. The accuracy of the support estimate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha')], []), ' is calculated with respect to the best ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['k = 10'], []), ' term approximation. From left to right, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.7'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.5'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' = 0.3'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:compressible_SNR_vs_rhok_p2')]), '\n'], []), '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section', [BraceGroup('Stylized Applications')]), TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec:applications')]), '\nIn this section, we apply standard and weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization to recover real video and audio signals that are compressively sampled.\n\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('Recovery of video signals')]), '\nOne natural application for weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization is video compressed sensing. Traditional video acquisition techniques capture a full frame (or image) in the pixel domain at a specific frame rate. The number of pixels acquired per image defines the spatial sampling rate, while the number of frames acquired per second defines the temporal sampling rate. Since the temporal sampling rate is usually high, a group of adjacent video frames are temporally correlated which is reflected in their spatial transform coefficients having nonzero entries in roughly the same locations. \n\nOur aim here is to reduce the number of samples acquired for each video frame while keeping the same reconstruction quality by recovering using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization. Here, we assume that for every video frame ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j'], []), ', the measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y_j'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', '\\{', '0, 1, ', TexCmd('hdots'), ', m-1', '\\}'], []), ', are acquired by storing the readings of a random subset of the CCD array with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['m'], []), ' denoting the total number of frames in the video sequence. Let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j'], []), ' be the number of measurements acquired per frame ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N'], []), ' be the spatial resolution (number of pixels) to be recovered per frame. Let ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' be the spatial sparsifying transform. The measurement matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A_j'], []), ' can then be written as ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['A_j = R_jD'], []), ', where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['R_j'], []), ' is an ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j ', TexCmd('times'), ' N'], []), ' restriction matrix, and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['D'], []), ' is an orthonormal basis. Note that the restriction matrix ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['R_j'], []), ' randomly selects ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j'], []), ' pixels from the ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N'], []), ' pixels in the CCD array to store their readings.\n\nFor the first frame, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j = 0'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_0'], []), ' measurements are captured and the\ntransform coefficients ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x_0'], []), ' are recovered by solving the standard\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization problem\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('nonumber'), '\n  ', TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_0 = ', TexCmd('argmin'), TexCmd('limits'), '_', BraceGroup('x'), ' ', '\\|', 'x', '\\|', '_1  ', TexCmd('text', [BraceGroup('subject to')]), '  Ax = y_0.\n'], []), '\nFor every subsequent frame ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j ', TexCmd('geq'), ' 1'], []), ', a support estimate\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('tilde', [BraceGroup('V')]), '_j'], []), ' is chosen to be the union of the locations of the nonzero\nentries of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-1')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-2')], []), ' that contribute a\ncertain percentage of the energy of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-1')], []), ' and\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-2')], []), ', respectively. Consequently, the coefficients\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_j'], []), ' are recovered from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j < n_0'], []), ' measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y_j'], []), ' by\nsolving the following weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization problem\n', TexNamedEnv('equation*', ['\n  ', TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_j = ', TexCmd('argmin'), '_', BraceGroup('x'), ' ', '\\|', 'x', '\\|', '_', BraceGroup('1,', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])), '  ', TexCmd('text', [BraceGroup('subject to')]), ' \n  Ax = y_j,\n  ', TexCmd('quad'), TexCmd('text', [BraceGroup('with')]), TexCmd('quad'), '\n  w_i=', TexNamedEnv('cases', ['\n    1,       & i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('tilde', [BraceGroup('V')]), '_j^c,\n  ', TexCmd('omega'), ',  & i ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', TexCmd('tilde', [BraceGroup('V')]), '_j,\n'], []), '\n'], []), '\nwhere ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' 1'], []), '.\n\nIn our experiments, we use the Foreman sequence at QCIF resolution,\ni.e., every frame contains ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['144', TexCmd('times'), ' 176'], []), ' pixels. We only consider\nthe luma (grayscale) component of the sequence. Every frame is split\ninto four blocks, each of size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N = 72', TexCmd('times'), ' 88'], []), ' which are processed\nindependently. We set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_0 = N/2'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = N/2.2'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = N/2.4'], []), '\nfor ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j ', TexCmd('geq'), ' 1'], []), '. The two dimensional discrete cosine transform (DCT) is used as the spatial\nsparsifying basis allowing for the support estimate ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('tilde', [BraceGroup('V')]), '_j'], []), ' to\ninclude the DC component and the union of the AC coefficients that\ncontribute to 97 percent  of the energy in the AC coefficients of each of\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-1')], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_', BraceGroup('j-2')], []), '. The signals ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '_j'], []), ' are then\nrecovered using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization for ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' equal to\n0, 0.1, 0.5, and 1.\n\nFigure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:foreman_wl1_alg2')]), ' illustrates the recovery of the first\n30 frames of the Foreman sequence using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\nminimization. The reconstruction quality is reported in terms of the\npeak signal to noise ratio (PSNR) given by the expression\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', ['\n\t', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('PSNR')]), '(x, ', TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), ') = 10', TexCmd('log'), '_', BraceGroup('10'), '(', TexCmd('frac', [BraceGroup('N', TexCmd('times'), ' 255^2'), BraceGroup('\\|', 'x-', TexCmd('hat', [BraceGroup('x')]), '\\|', '_2^2')]), ').\n'], []), ' \nThe figure demonstrates that recovery with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' = 0.5'], []), ' results in an improvement in PSNR averaging around 1~dB compared to standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' using the same number of measurements. A striking observation is that weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization outperforms standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' also with fewer measurements, i.e., in the case where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = n_0'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('forall'), ' j'], []), ' for standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ', whereas ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = n_0/2.2'], []), ' for weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '. \n\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=7in'), BraceGroup('foreman_wl1_alg2.pdf')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Recovery of the first 30 frames of the Foreman\n          sequence at QCIF resolution. The first frame is recovered\n          from ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_0 = N/2'], []), ' measurements, while the remaining frames\n          are recovered from (a) ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = N/2.2'], []), ' and (b) ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = N/2.4'], []), '\n          measurements. Recovery is performed using weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), '\n          minimization with ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', '\\{', '0, 0.1, 0.5, 1', '\\}'], []), '. The\n          support estimate is derived from the union of the supports\n          of the previous two frames. The black curve corresponds to\n          the recovered PSNR using standard ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization with\n          a fixed number of measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j = n_0'], []), ', ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('forall'), ' j ', TexCmd('in'), '\n          ', '\\{', '1,', TexCmd('dots'), ', 30', '\\}'], []), '.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:foreman_wl1_alg2')]), '\n'], []), '\n\t', '\n', TexCmd('subsection', [BraceGroup('Recovery of audio signals')]), '\nFor our second stylized application, we examine the performance of\nweighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' minimization for the recovery of compressed sensing\nmeasurements of speech signals. In particular, the original signals\nare sampled at ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['44.1'], []), ' kHz, but only ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['1/4'], []), 'th of the samples are retained\n(with their indices chosen randomly from the uniform\ndistribution). This yields the measurements ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y=Rs'], []), ', where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['s'], []), ' is the\nspeech signal and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['R'], []), ' is a restriction (of the identity)\noperator. Consequently, by dividing the measurements into blocks of size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N'], []), ', we\ncan write ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y=', '[', 'y_1^T,y_2^T,...', ']', '^T'], []), '. Here each ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['y_j=R_j s_j'], []), ' is the\nmeasurement vector corresponding to the ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j'], []), 'th block of the signal, and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['R_j', TexCmd('in'), TexCmd('R'), '^', BraceGroup('n_j', TexCmd('times'), ' N')], []), ' is the associated restriction matrix. The signals we use in our experiments consist of 21 such blocks.\nWe make the following assumptions about speech signals: \n', TexNamedEnv('enumerate', ['\n', TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item'), TexCmd('item')], []), '\nThus, for the reconstruction of the ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['j'], []), 'th block, we choose the support estimate  ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '=', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^1', TexCmd('cup'), TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^2'], []), '. Here, ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^1'], []), ' is the set corresponding to frequencies up to 4kHz and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^2'], []), '\nis the set corresponding to the largest ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['n_j/16'], []), ' recovered coefficients of the\nprevious block (for the first block ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^2'], []), ' is empty).  The results of experiments on two speech signals (one male and one female) with\n', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['N=2048'], []), ', and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), ' ', TexCmd('in'), ' ', '\\{', '0,1/6,2/6,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',1', '\\}'], []), ' are illustrated in\nFigure~', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:audio')]), '.\n', TexNamedEnv('figure*', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t', TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=4in'), BraceGroup('audio_results.pdf')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('SNRs of two reconstructed signals (male and female\n          voices) from compressed sensing measurements plotted against ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), '. For both speech signals, an intermediate value of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega')], []), ' yields the best performance.')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:audio')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('h')]), '\n', '\n ', '\n', '\n', TexCmd('section', [BraceGroup('Proof of Theorem ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('thm:weighted_L1_recovery')]))]), TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('sec:Proof')]), '\n Recall that ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ', an arbitrary subset of ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\{', '1,2,', TexCmd('ldots'), ',N', '\\}'], []), ',  is of size ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), ' where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['0 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('rho'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' a'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['a'], []), ' is some number larger than 1. Let the set ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha')), ' = T_0 ', TexCmd('cap'), ' ', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('beta')), ' = T_0^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' ', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), ', where ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['|', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('alpha')), '| = ', TexCmd('alpha'), ' |', TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '| = ', TexCmd('alpha'), ' ', TexCmd('rho'), ' k'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('alpha'), ' + ', TexCmd('beta'), ' = 1'], []), '.\nFigure ', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('fig:Sets_Weights')]), ' illustrates these sets and shows the relationship to the weight vector ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])], []), '.\n', TexNamedEnv('figure', ['\n\t', TexCmd('centering'), '\n\t\t', TexCmd('includegraphics', [BracketGroup('width=5in'), BraceGroup('fig_sets_weights.pdf')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('caption', [BraceGroup('Illustration of the signal ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x'], []), ' and weight vector ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])], []), ' emphasizing the relationship between the sets ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['T_0'], []), ' and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])], []), '.  ')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('fig:Sets_Weights')]), '\n'], [BracketGroup('h')]), '\n', '\n', '\nLet ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['x^* = x + h'], []), '  be a minimizer of the weighted ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('ell'), '_1'], []), ' problem  (', TexCmd('ref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), '). Then\n', TexNamedEnv('equation*', ['\n\t ', '\\|', 'x + h', '\\|', '_', BraceGroup('1,', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])), '  ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', '\\|', 'x', '\\|', '_', BraceGroup('1,', TexCmd('mathrm', [BraceGroup('w')])), '.\n'], []), '\nMoreover, by the choice of weights in ', TexCmd('eqref', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_L1')]), ', we have\n', TexNamedEnv('equation*', ['\n ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1 ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')])), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c'), '\\|', '_1. \n'], []), '\nConsequently, \n', TexNamedEnv('equation*', ['\n', TexNamedEnv('array', ['\n ', '& ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 \n\t  ', TexCmd('quad'), '+ ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), ' + h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1  \n\t& ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1.\n'], [BraceGroup('ll')]), '\n'], []), '\nNext, we use the forward and reverse triangle inequalities to get\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('nonumber'), '\n\t', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1  ', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1  + 2(', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1).\n'], []), '\nAdding and subtracting ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1'], []), ' on the left hand side, and ', TexMathModeEnv('$', [TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1'], []), ' on the right, we obtain\n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('nonumber'), '\n', TexNamedEnv('array', ['\n', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 & + ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1  -', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1\n\t&', TexCmd('leq'), ' ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 +  ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 - ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 \n\t & ', TexCmd('quad'), ' ', TexCmd('quad'), ' + ', TexCmd('quad'), ' 2(', TexCmd('omega'), ' ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 - ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'x_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1).\n'], [BraceGroup('ll')]), '\n'], []), '\nSince ', TexMathModeEnv('$', ['\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup('T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 =  ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), ' ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 + ', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1'], []), ', this easily reduces to \n', TexNamedEnv('equation', [TexCmd('label', [BraceGroup('eq:weighted_optimality')]), '\n\t', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup('T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 +  (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0^c'), '\\|', '_1 \n\t ', TexCmd('leq'), '  ', TexCmd('omega'), '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup('T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + (1-', TexCmd('omega'), ')', '\\|', 'h_', BraceGroup(TexCmd('widetilde', [BraceGroup('T')]), '^c ', TexCmd('cap'), ' T_0'), '\\|', '_1 + 2(', TexCmd('omega'),
